main event: A circular, silver colored object with a tail of sparks was observed in Las Vegas, Nevada on February 8, 1960.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a silver dollar and emitted sparks that were 3 to 5 times its length., The sighting lasted for approximately 10 minutes., The best description was given by a civilian control tower operator who noted it acted like a meteor., Multiple witnesses reported seeing the object, with several airborne reports from different areas., The object faded out or disappeared behind mountains.
sighted object: circular silver object with a tail of sparks
witness description: civilian control tower operator and other witnesses in the area
